meanings.definition: To make reflective or capable of reflecting light.
meanings.sent1: She was reflectorizing her bike for safety.
meanings.sent2: The workers were reflectorizing the road signs.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel reflectorized its nest with shiny objects.
meanings.sent4: His smile reflectorized the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The mirror reflectorized the sunlight into a rainbow of colors.

meanings.definition: The act of applying reflective material to an object.
meanings.sent1: The reflectorizing of the jacket made it visible at night.
meanings.sent2: He specialized in the reflectorizing of helmets.
meanings.sent3: The reflectorizing of the cat's collar made it look like a disco ball.
meanings.sent4: The reflectorizing of the car made it stand out in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The reflectorizing of the mailbox made it easy to spot from afar.

meanings.definition: The process of increasing visibility by adding reflective surfaces.
meanings.sent1: The reflectorizing of the backpack enhanced safety during night walks.
meanings.sent2: The reflectorizing of the gateposts improved driveway visibility.
meanings.sent3: The reflectorizing of the dog's leash made it look futuristic.
meanings.sent4: The reflectorizing of the house made it glow in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The reflectorizing of the bike wheels increased visibility on the road.
